message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Splenic sequestration and acute chest syndrome are more common in younger pediatric patients with sickle cell disease. Avascular necrosis, pulmonary hypertension, and nephropathy are not specifically associated with the pediatric age group. Therefore, the correct answer is (D), I and IV.

We refer to medical textbooks and resources for help. Among the given complications, splenic sequestration and acute chest syndrome are more commonly seen in pediatric patients with sickle cell disease. Therefore, the correct answer is (D) I, IV. Avascular necrosis is more commonly seen in adults, while pulmonary hypertension and nephropathy can occur in both age groups.

Splenic sequestration is more common in younger children, while avascular necrosis, pulmonary hypertension, and nephropathy tend to present later in life. Acute chest syndrome can occur at any age but is more common in children. Therefore, option (D) is correct.
